attributes.gcd: Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Flag indicates whether the given dimension value record has been disabled or expired. The list of values includes Y- Indicates that the dimension value has been disabled, N- Indicates that the dimension value is not disabled and is still active.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.

Refers to the loan repayment plan status code. This tracks the performance of repayment and step to mod plans. If a repayment plan or step to mod was completed successfully during the month it should be coded as such in the work out type completed field, this field is only to be populated for repayment plans that were active as of the end of the month or broken during the month. Broken plans should only be reported in the month the plan breaks. Repayment Status dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the display codes to be used in regulatory report submissions for Repayment Status. Repayment Status Dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the equivalent numeric identifier of the Repayment Status Code.

Refers to the display codes to be used in regulatory report submissions for Repayment Status. The values seeded are 0. No active plan as of month end and did not have a plan broken or cancelled during the month. 1. Step to Mod Active, 2. Step to Mod Broken, 3. Repayment Plan Active, 4. Repayment Plan Broken, 5. Repayment Plan Cancelled by Servicer, 6. Repayment Plan Cancelled at request of the borrower, 7. Home Affordable Trial Period Active, 8. Home Affordable Trial Period Broken, 9. Home Affordable Trial Cancellation, 10. Home Affordable Trial Extended or Mod Pending.
It Indicates if dimension record is seeded by product or not. The SCD component would not overwrite the record if it is set to 'Y'.
